title: Dashboard button sizing + metrics fix + consistent button colors + solid Settings dialogs

requirements.text: On the Dashboard page, reduce the visual size of the “Browse by Category” category cards/buttons by ~50% (padding, icon size, and typography) while keeping the same number of categories and the same click/navigation behavior.

quotes: Dashboard - browse by category - reduce buttons by 50%

acceptanceCriteria: In the Dashboard “Browse by Category” section, each category card occupies noticeably less space (approximately half the current visual footprint).
Clicking a category card still navigates to /documents with the correct categoryId search param.
Clicking the “View Documents” button inside a card still works and does not trigger double navigation.

requirements.text: On the Dashboard page, update the category action button styling so the category buttons use a light blue color as the primary visual accent (consistent across light/dark modes).

quotes: add light blue colour to the buttons.

acceptanceCriteria: The Dashboard “View Documents” button in each category card uses a light-blue appearance (not the default ghost style).
Text remains readable with sufficient contrast in both light and dark mode.

requirements.text: Fix “Documents by Direction” counts on the Dashboard so Inward/Outward/Important reflect the actual number of stored documents by reading the direction field from the backend documents data (not returning 0 when documents exist).

quotes: dashboard - Documents by direction count not responding it shows count 0 .

acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo getDashboardMetrics returns exact counts for inwardDocuments/outwardDocuments/importantDocuments by iterating all stored documents and counting by document.direction.
With at least 1 stored document of each direction, the Dashboard shows non-zero counts matching the backend data.
No changes are required to the frontend query hook (useDashboardMetrics continues calling actor.getDashboardMetrics()).

requirements.text: Update the Upload page primary action button styling so the upload button uses color #0052cc (including hover/active states) and remains readable in both light and dark modes.

quotes: upload - upload download button use color #0052cc.

acceptanceCriteria: On UploadDocumentPage, the “Upload Document” submit button background is #0052cc.
Hover/focus states remain visually clear and accessible.

requirements.text: In Settings, style the “Add Category” button so it appears inside a visually distinct box using color #0052cc, and ensure the Add Category / Add Office forms have a solid (non-transparent) background when opened (solid white in light mode).

quotes: settings - add category button should be in a box colored #0052cc .
form open when we click on button i want background of that form solid

acceptanceCriteria: On SettingsPage, the “Add Category” button is visually presented with a #0052cc box/background treatment (not default styling).
When the Add Category dialog opens, the dialog content has a solid white background in light mode (no transparency).
When the Add Office dialog opens, the dialog content has a solid white background in light mode (no transparency).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional canisters/services.
Do not edit frontend files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn UI sources); only override styling via composition/className in app components.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Changing the number of categories shown on the Dashboard (only reduce size, not quantity).
Adding new metrics beyond Total Documents/Users and the existing direction counts.
Implementing new authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).
